question_sentence: A Michigan couple bought a cabinet for $100 in 1950. This year it sold for $48,000. Who designed the storage unit?
True or false: Tesla’s market value reached $1 trillion this week, becoming the first company to do so.
Brooklyn-based collective MSCHF is putting up an Andy Warhol sketch valued at about $20,000 for $250. However, it is selling:
choices: The sketch dipped in red ink
The sketch at a hidden location

question_sentence: Which of these Halloween costumes is one of the top 10 costumes in the U.S. this year, according to Google Trends?
Soccer legend Carli Lloyd retired from international play this week. How many goals did she score for the USWNT in her career?
A Wisconsin judge ruled that the people shot by Kyle Rittenhouse, two of them fatally, can be called "looters" but not:
"Carol's Journey to QAnon" is:
choices: A Facebook experiment to study its algorithm
An undercover operation by the FBI

question_sentence: A $5 million class-action lawsuit alleges that Kellogg’s:
choices: Stole the recipe for Rice Krispies Treats
Doesn’t put real cheese in Cheez Its
Doesn’t put enough strawberries in Pop-Tarts

question_sentence: Alec Baldwin discharged a prop gun that killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the set of "Rust." In which state were they filming?
What percentage of Americans know vaccinated people are less likely to test positive for COVID-19, per an Axios/Ipsos poll?
A High Court battle involving the ruler of which city has been touted as ‘the biggest divorce case in British legal history’?
evidence: Jordan’s Princess Haya has launched a court bid to claim what experts predict may be a record-breaking divorce settlement from her estranged billionaire husband, Dubai ruler Sheikh Mohammed

question_sentence: An ex-adviser to which former US secretary of state is claiming to have been sexually assaulted by an unnamed senator?
evidence: Huma Abedin has claimed in a new memoir that the senator tried to kiss her after inviting her to his home following a Washington dinner in the mid-2000s

question_sentence: The Pakistan cricket team has been celebrating beating which rival side in the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup at the 13th attempt?
evidence: Pakistan defeated the neighbouring nation in a ten-wicket win that ended a World Cup curse for the victors

question_sentence: Which world leader should face criminal charges over their handling of the Covid pandemic, according to a scathing new report approved by the nation’s senate?
evidence: Senators voted in favour of holding ‘serial killer’ Bolsonaro liable for Brazil’s Covid death toll, which is the second-highest in the world after the US

question_sentence: The Ministry of Defence is facing renewed calls to investigate claims that a woman murdered in which African country in 2012 was killed by a British soldier?
evidence: The military has been accused of a cover-up over the killing of 21-year-old Agnes Wanjiru, who was last seen with a British soldier before her body was discovered in a hotel septic tank

question_sentence: A one-of-a-kind digital trading card of which football player is expected to sell for $1m (£727m) at an upcoming online sale?
evidence: The non-fungible token (FNT) trading card is still valid for use in Sorare, a digital fantasy football game, and goes under the hammer in an online Bonhams auction that kicks off on 1 November

question_sentence: UK intelligence agency GCHQ has signed a deal with which technology giant to host ‘Britain’s most classified material’?
evidence: The deal with Amazon Web Services is reportedly worth between £500m and £1bn over the next ten years

question_sentence: What is the name of the prime minister arrested this week in an apparent power grab by the Sudan military?
evidence: Hamdok and other civilian members of his transitional government were detained on 25 October and taken to an undisclosed location, in an attempted military coup

question_sentence: Leaked Treasury documents say that introducing Boris Johnson’s so-called Plan B Covid restrictions could cost the UK economy how much over five months?
evidence: The files detail the potential cost of having measures including compulsory face masks and vaccine passports, as well as advice to work from home, in place until March 2022

question_sentence: Which country is mulling an anti-gay bill described by activists as ‘the most draconian anti-LGBTQ legislation on Earth’?
evidence: Gay and transgender people could be sentenced to up to five years in prison, and ‘allies’ could be jailed for a decade, under legislation being voted on in Ghana

question_sentence: A national commission voted in favor of recommending criminal charges against its country’s leader for their handling of the Covid-19 pandemic. Which leader is at the center of the controversy?
choices: President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines
Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India
evidence: Seven Brazilian senators voted to support the report’s recommendations calling for charges against President Jair Bolsonaro, as well as two companies and dozens of other individuals.

question_sentence: US President Joe Biden is in Europe for his second major foreign trip. What’s his first stop on the tour?
evidence: Biden’s first stop is in Rome, where he will meet with world leaders for the G20 summit. He will then head to Glasgow, Scotland for the COP26 UN climate summit.

question_sentence: France has detained a British vessel and announced that it will close nearly all French ports to similar boats, escalating an ongoing dispute between the two countries. What issue is at the center of the cross-Channel spat?
evidence: The dispute centers on fishing permissions within the countries’ waters, with confusion and tensions amplified by new restrictions following Brexit.

question_sentence: Disney and Pixar released a new teaser trailer for a new film that will focus on which beloved Pixar character?
choices: James P. Sullivan from the movie “Monsters, Inc.”
Buzz Lightyear from the “Toy Story” movies
evidence: Disney and Pixar released a brand new teaser trailer for the upcoming movie “Lightyear” which will portray the “real” story behind the beloved Toy Story character Buzz Lightyear.

question_sentence: Nobel laureate Aung San Suu Kyi testified in court, all under a gag order imposed by the controlling military junta. From what country was she ousted as civilian leader following a military coup earlier this year?
evidence: Suu Kyi was Myanmar’s state counselor and de facto leader. She is now facing a swath of charges that could her put behind bars for decades.

question_sentence: Facebook has announced it is rebranding. What is the company’s new corporate name?
evidence: Facebook announced that it is changing its corporate name to Meta, an ode to the concept of the virtual-reality, augmented-reality concept of an online “metaverse.”

question_sentence: Which two MLB teams are currently facing off in the 2021 World Series?
choices: The Atlanta Braves and the Boston Red Sox
The Houston Astros and the Los Angeles Dodgers
The Los Angeles Dodgers and the Tampa Bay Rays
The Atlanta Braves and the Houston Astros
evidence: The Atlanta Braves and the Houston Astros are competing in the best-of-seven series. This is the Braves’ first World Series appearance in more than two decades, and the Astros’ third appearance in five years.

question_sentence: A consumer has filed a $5 million class-action lawsuit against Kellogg’s, claiming Pop-Tarts pastries have a very specific and misleading flaw. What is the alleged flaw?
choices: they are not “tarts” in the culinary sense
they should not be marketed as a breakfast food
evidence: The lawsuit specifically names “Frosted Strawberry Toaster Pastries,” and says the snacks don’t contain enough fruit, thereby misleading customers into thinking they are healthier than they are.

question_sentence: Which pop star just netted the most nominations for this year’s 2021 American Music Awards?
evidence: In her first time ever being nominated, Olivia Rodrigo is leading the charge with 7 nominations, including artist of the year.

question_sentence: With global supply chain issues compounding, which US state is scrambling to relieve an estimated $24 billion worth of goods being held up on container ships, waiting to enter its ports?
evidence: The goods, are being held off the coast of California, with dozens of ships waiting to enter the Ports of Los Angeles and Long Beach.
